title: Judaism: The Religion That Started It All
description: A short lesson to help you apply Judaism: The Religion That Started It All.

hook.text: Christianity and Islam both trace their roots to one small tribe in the desert. Judaism invented monotheism.

buildup.text: Around 2000 BCE, Abraham made a covenant with one God. This radical idea set Judaism apart from all neighbors.

climax.text: The smallest of the Big Five had the biggest influence. Judaism's ideas are the foundation Western civilization uses.

punchline.text: 16 million Jews shaped religions with 4 billion followers. Size isn't all.

quiz.question: What makes Judaism historically unique among major religions?
options: It pioneered monotheism and shaped Christianity and Islam
